title: Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle | One Of The Toughest Passages - Hebrew Israelites | Give Me an Answer
description:
Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located New Canaan High School,  11 Farm Rd.  New Canaan CT, 06840

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues 
Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses 
throughout the United States. Stuart joined his dad Cliffe in 2015 and 
they've teamed up to do this together. These universities include Tennessee 
Maine, Harvard, MIT, Florida, University of Texas, Texas State, Arizona, 
Princeton, Michigan State, UCLA, UC Davis, Berkeley, Stanford, Oregon State, 
and UMass. Amherst.  
Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at 
noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up 
the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four 
hour dialogue with students. 
His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, 
new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to 
reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.


#givemeananswer #cliffeknechtle #stuartknechtle
channel_title: Give Me An Answer with Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle

title: Stuart Knechtle | Stanford | You Would Need Some Kind Of Really BIG GOD! | Give Me an Answer
description:
Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located New Canaan High School,  11 Farm Rd.  New Canaan CT, 06840

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues 
Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses 
throughout the United States. Stuart joined his dad Cliffe in 2015 and 
they've teamed up to do this together. These universities include Tennessee 
Maine, Harvard, MIT, Florida, University of Texas, Texas State, Arizona, 
Princeton, Michigan State, UCLA, UC Davis, Berkeley, Stanford, Oregon State, 
and UMass. Amherst.  
Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at 
noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up 
the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four 
hour dialogue with students. 
His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, 
new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to 
reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

title: Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle | Is God Powerful Enough To Raise Jesus From The Dead? | Give Me An Answer
description:
Give Me An Answer: In this episode Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle talk to non-believers in Jesus about who Jesus was and the Gospel of Jesus.

Recorded at Stanford - March 2025

Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located New Canaan High School,  11 Farm Rd.  New Canaan CT, 06840

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues 
Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses 
throughout the United States. Stuart joined his dad Cliffe in 2015 and 
they've teamed up to do this together. These universities include Tennessee 
Maine, Harvard, MIT, Florida, University of Texas, Texas State, Arizona, 
Princeton, Michigan State, UCLA, UC Davis, Berkeley, Stanford, Oregon State, 
and UMass. Amherst.  
Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at 
noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up 
the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four 
hour dialogue with students. 
His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, 
new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to 
reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

title: Stuart Knechtle | Oregon State | What Do You Think About Jesus? | Give Me an Answer
description:
Recorded at Oregon State - Oct. 2024
Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located New Canaan High School,  11 Farm Rd.  New Canaan CT, 06840

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues 
Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses 
throughout the United States. Stuart joined his dad Cliffe in 2015 and 
they've teamed up to do this together. These universities include Tennessee 
Maine, Harvard, MIT, Florida, University of Texas, Texas State, Arizona, 
Princeton, Michigan State, UCLA, UC Davis, Berkeley, Stanford, Oregon State, 
and UMass. Amherst.  
Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at 
noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up 
the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four 
hour dialogue with students. 
His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, 
new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to 
reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

title: Stuart Knechtle | Yale | Trusting Jesus Leads To Eternal Life | Give Me an Answer
description:
Recorded at Yale University - Sept 2024

Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located New Canaan High School,  11 Farm Rd.  New Canaan CT, 06840

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

title: Give Me an Answer - It Dishonors All Faiths To Say That They Are All The Same
description:
Program 1024 ...................   -  Faiths  - Manuscripts  -  Religions     ..............
Recorded at Texas - October 2023.

Follow on Instagram: stuart_knechtle
Follow on Tiktok: stuartknechtle for latest clips
Subscribe on YouTube

Join us in person for a Sunday service at 9:30amET at Grace Community Church located at Grace Farms (365 Lukes Wood Road New Canaan CT, 06840).

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

Our (MDD) story: My name is James Kunz and I'm a doctoral student in psychology in Colorado, US. In my own academic journey, many academics (though to be fair, not all) have become closed to controversial people or topics and actually want to exclude people that question the status quo. Thus, my goal is to provide a non-partisan and truly-tolerant debate platform that welcomes everyone.

1. Preferred opponent, topic & your position on it.
2. A link to a past debate you've had.
3. Any days of the week that you're open at 9 PM EST

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

title: People Long For Friendship - Stuart Knechtle
description:
The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.

description:
Cliffe Knechtle has a great conversation with college students at a campus in the southwest US. 
The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This is an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.
channel_title: Give Me An Answer with Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle

channel_title: Give Me An Answer with Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle

title: Give Me an Answer  #2909 a - Michigan State - Part 1
description: Cliffe Knechtle has a dialogue with students at Michigan State, September of 2009. This is Part 1. The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This was an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.
channel_title: Give Me An Answer with Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle

The "Give Me An Answer" ministry began as an outgrowth of the dialogues Cliffe Knechtle has had with students on various university campuses throughout the United States. These universities include the University of Maine, Harvard, MIT, University of Florida, University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Minnesota, University of California Los Angeles, University of California San Diego, Berkeley, Stanford, University of Hawaii and the University of Washington. Cliffe spoke on these campuses in front of the Student Union or Library at noon for five to ten minutes. At the close of his initial remarks, he'd open up the time for questions and answers, which usually turned into a two to four hour dialogue with students. His crowd size ranged from 25 - 500 students at a time, and between classes, new students would join the discussion. This was an extremely effective way to reach a large number of university students with the Gospel of Christ.
channel_title: Give Me An Answer with Stuart & Cliffe Knechtle
